title: For the Tired
author: Mason Griswold
poem: Orange flowers blossom in the spring
Their fire only comes after the harsh winter
They're freckled with the tragedy of their growth
But, there is no more beautiful sight
Time always gives us the light blues skies we want
Yes, they may be stolen away by a storm
But, they will always come back
Thousands have written about your life
So bear this cross until it's your virtue
Work through today so tomorrow will come
Tomorrow is always so far away
But without today, tomorrow is nothing
